poem:
"Rivers and Regulators"

Standoff in a liquid theatre, bricks 
of brinkmanship broken into bathtubs.
Frayed wires over Thames water, whispers 
seep through the underworld; investors, regulators,
a coin toss in the quiet. The spat 
runs hot; a heated conversation, a simmering pot.
One eye on the nationalisation, the other on the weather vane,
A long game, a short reign.
